newsitem.title: GERMANY: SOCCER-GERMANY SUMMON NEWCOMER RICKEN TO SQUAD.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-GERMANY SUMMON NEWCOMER RICKEN TO SQUAD.

text.p: Borussia Dortmund's young attacking midfielder Lars Ricken was called into Germany's squad of 22 on Monday for a World Cup qualifier against Northern Ireland on August 20.

The 21-year-old, a key figure in Dortmund's European Cup- winning campaign last season despite his tender years, is set to make his senior debut in place of veteran Dieter Eilts for the match in Belfast.
"I'm really pleased. Its recognition for achievement but also motivation for me to improve," said Ricken, who has graduated from the German under-21 squad.
The dropping of Werder Bremen's Eilts, capped 31 times, surprised some but Germany coach Berti Vogts was unrepentant. "He has been a disappointment recently," he said.
Ricken could not be ignored after scoring plenty of goals last season -- some vital and some that were simply impressive.
Of the former, he scored the goals that dumped France's Auxerre out of the European Cup quarter-finals and Manchester United out of the semifinals.
In the final, he scored the third individual goal against Juventus in a 3-1 win -- just 16 seconds after going on a substitute.
Injury-plagued European Footballer of the Year Matthias Sammer will miss Belfast after damaging his knee in Dortmund's season opener against Hertha Berlin.
He had surgery last week for cartilage damage and will be replaced by Karlsruhe's Thomas Haessler, who returns after nine months out due to a fractured left leg.
South African-born striker and club mate Sean Dundee, called up against Ukraine in June, is out.

Vogts kept faith with three Italian-based players -- Juergen Klinsmann at Sampdoria, Christian Ziege at AC Milan and Oliver Bierhoff at Udinese -- despite the fact that the Italian league season does not start until the end of the month.

The game in Belfast will be the first time since 1988 that the national team have competed in a qualifier without a practice game beforehand. Vogts said playing cold was "a compromise which I had to make".
Germany are second in European group nine, two points behind Ukraine but with two games in hand. They are level with Portugal on points but again have a game in hand.

Vogts was happy with Germany's standing but "not with the way we presented ourselves" and had written to all of his players urging them to fulfil their duty. "I hope very much that all the players will heed my advice," he said.
